text: Quality subs! We tried this place tonight on a recommendation from a friend and it did not disappoint! The seasoned chip/fries were so good dipped in the house made ranch and the subs were big, tasty and filling. We ordered a cannoli but were too full to eat it. Saving it for later but it looks delicious. We will definitely be back.
Sandwiches are creating and tasty. The bread was amazing toasted and just right. Had the turkey sandwiches and will definitely be back here !

Was very disappointing, Skinny Dip was pretty bland, mac and cheese was also bland and mushy. Would rather have gone to Jimmy Johns, Firehouse or even Subway they all taste better and they're all cheaper. Only went because of its high ratings, this place doesn't deserve anything higher than a 2 or 3 based on my experience. Plus there's a chance it might've gotten me sick.

Have tried the Skinny Dip and the Knuckle Sandwich sandwiches. Neither disappointed in any way. Everything is made to order, fresh bread, quality ingredients, friendly and helpful staff. Everything you are looking for in an establishment where you wish to exchange cash for goods and services. I can't wait to work my way through the rest of the menu.
Great subs for a great price and they come with fries!  I've never had subs in Las Vegas like these, very unique and tasty.  Definitely worth trying.
Its ok.  Cool consent for a sub shop. The folks there were very nice and quite helpful.  Don't be in a hurry.  We had a party of 4 and it seamed to take a wile. As I said it's OK

The skinny dip was the best sandwich I've had in years!  Perfect amount of everything, delicious bread.  I highly recommend the funnel sticks.  This place was clean and amazing will be back for sure!!!

I've wanted to stop in for a few weeks now so today was the day and I was not disappointed! Very friendly and helpful staff, fun eating area, but above all amazing food! I went with what they said was a top seller, the skinny dip (#2). Great mix between Philly cheesesteak and French dip. Very flavorful, and fresh! Only bad thing was it went down way to fast! It was that good. Looking for a new place to eat with great subs, upbeat atmosphere, and friendly staff, give these guys a go! You won't be disappointed. Excited to come back next time for breakfast

AMAZING food...HOWEVER, they seemed to be shaking their heads at the fact we used a Groupon?  Commenting about "nothing like free stuff." If you don't wanna sell your sandwiches discounted on Groupon then don't, but we're still paying customers  The guy seemed to be pissed the entire time while making the food.  So while I DO recommend the food, I also warn against shitty customer service lol.

Drove by and was excited to try something new and locally owned. The menu looked good, and i ordered a meatball sub. Half of it ended up in the trash. Meatballs had zero flavor, just covered with sauce and cheese. Subway does a better meatball sub. Sorry, had to be honest.

Love this place!!  Delicious every time!  There are not many places I love to eat because I'm very particular about quality and freshness of ingredients and so many places are not consistently good. 7 Sinful Subs has been excellent each of the 3 times I've been there. I love the Meat Hater and my boyfriend loves the Baller.   The place is very clean and the staff is really friendly and helpful. It's one of my fave places to eat!

Really good! 

I purchased a Groupon for 7 Sinful Subs, and today was my first visit. 

I split the Knuckle Sandwich with my dining companion. We also shared the stack o' coins and the mac and cheese. We opted for the lettuce, mayo, tomato, and vinaigrette to come on the side, as I am not a fan of any of these things on a hot sandwich. We also opted to order the sandwich with their hot sauce. 

The hot sauce came in a tiny container on the side. We could have used more, but it was really good. It was the perfect addition to this sandwich. 

The sandwich itself is packed full of meat. The bread is soft but stands up to the toppings. I enjoyed it. 

The stack o' coins was unexpectedly awesome. I really enjoyed the level of spice, and the potatoes were not soft, not crunchy. 

The mac and cheese was the only disappointment. The potato chips were a nice addition to the top, but the mac and cheese lacked flavor. It needed an additional, stronger cheese or something.

Overall, I would go back. The food is solid, and the service is stellar.

We randomly saw this place around lunchtime and decided to stop in. SO HAPPY WE DID. Holy hell, this place is amazing. Normally I'm not a fan of places with small, specific menus however, this sandwich shop knows what they're doing. The knuckle sandwich was our favorite hands down! We will absolutely be coming back (side note: it was so good that I just didn't this Yelp review in the parking lot)
Great sandwiches...an oasis in a desert of dining...go here if you want a great meal at a reasonable price...

Bravo, your food is absolutely delicious. I am a total sub sandwich connoisseur and am always on the hunt for the next best sandwich. Every bite is bursting with flavor and the bread is the perfect combination of toast and soft. Prices are high for a sandwich but in my opinion, this place is worth the money!!

I don't think we ever ate a sandwich so fast! All my husband kept saying was"Oh my goodness the damn bread!" We had the Skinny dip Sub which was put together perfectly and some jalape√±os would've sent it over the top for me and the circle fries brought back some great childhood memories of Fish N Chips off of Lake Mead and Las Vegas Blvd! We can't wait to try the other subs! I don't think my diet will ever start at this rate!

Just tried samples of these subs today and they are hands down the best sandwich I have ever had. I used to go to their competitor but that ends today. Marinara sauce was legit and I would bathe in their a juis sauce. Do yourself a favor and grab one of these today!

Overall: The menu consists of 7 signature subs plus a plain sub and 2 salads. Food actually looked like pictures! Interesting twist of ingredients for subs. Playlist is AC-DC, Motley Crue, Metallica, etc. 

Food: The subs were quite tasty and filling. The chips are round French fries sprinkled with seasoning.

Seating: 2 side walls had high counter top with bar stools (nose bleed seats), rest is square table with heavy-duty plastic armless chairs

It is still the soft opening and there are several areas that need to be addressed. 1. It's at least a 10 minute wait for food (no one else was there) 2. Ran out of potato salad on a Wednesday at 1:20 pm 3. Soda fountain is behind the counter - what a pain! And way too much ice in cup (3/4 cup was ice)

I was definitely not having it with the worst service in the world today. Literally I was genuinely excited to try this place out and when I came in at 6, no line and no one at front. Someone from the back saw us for a quick second and went to the back. And we were just waiting for what felt like hours until a worker who just finished with a phone call outside came in and helped us. She apologized for the wait and said that if no one was at the front, I could yell out for someone because theyre all in the back. Well, what does that tell me about their customer service then? Maybe I'll come back and re-review this place because the sandwhiches we got (knuckle sandwich and skinny dip) were actually very delicious but not enough for me to change my ranking at this moment. 

--

Adding another 2 stars because the nice lady who helped us gave us 2 free deserts because of the wait time. Thank you!

Are you hungry enough for a knuckle sandwich? Well, come and get it!
The restaurant name is literal: there are only seven sandwiches on their menu. On the bright side, the portion sizes are huge and the prices are low, so they definitely picked the right location across the street from UNLV. I can see this being a huge hit with students with limited income. 

The knuckle sandwich contains grilled salami, pepperoni, and ham with melted mozarella, topped with what appears to be a small salad of lettuce, tomato, and champagne vinaigrette. I actually really enjoyed the salad part, which was fresh and helped offset the overall heaviness of the sandwich and also the overwhelming saltiness. Perhaps leaving the salami fresh may help with that? Sandwiches come with a choice of side- the "stack o chips" are coin-cut fries with a seasoning that was also fairly salty.  Might be a good idea to move the soda fountain to the dining room instead of behind the counter.

Service was quick and fast and the location has plenty of seating. Note that they close at 5PM daily, so unless you're a senior (citizen), it's likely a lunch-only option. The Italian Chick-en Vegas seems to be their most popular option, will try it when in the area again.

It really is too bad I can't give this more than 5 stars! OMG! GO! (Do I really need to say more?)

Ok I will...

Go!
I had the Skinny Dip and Oh.my.goodness. it was AMAZING!! The portion was huge so I was able to eat half for lunch and the other half for dinner later. The meat was obviously slow cooked to perfection. The cannoli reminded me of New York City! It was the best I have found in Vegas, or at least as close as I have gotten to NYC deliciousness!

But wait, there is more!

I HAD to go back Saturday for the 'Walk o Shame'. It looked so good, and is only served on Saturdays. This was enough for both myself and my husband to share and still have a little left over. It was by and far the BEST breakfast sandwich I have ever had. Ever. I will definitely be back because I need to try the other 6 subs and the funnel cake things!

Inside is really cool and modern. The sandwich names and pictures make you drool. Everything looks so good. I got two orders of the skinny dip to go. It was a bit of a wait but I didn't mind because it was busy and my food was fresh. I wish I took it out of the bag and checked my boxes though because both of my sides are left out. You can see on my receipt that I ordered potato chips and paid extra for fries and I didn't get either one. Unfortunately by the time I saw this, I was already home and it wasn't worth it to drive all the way back. Kind of pricey but you get what you pay for. The skinny dip was delicious. I put crushed red peppers on it for heat and I devoured the entire thing.

The place looks great,  the food is amazing (fries are spectacular! ),  but the girl who greeted me and gave me my order (my receipt says Golchin) was, without a doubt, what I liked the most about my first visit to this sandwich joint. She was so nice,  attentive and pleasant! The smile on her face and her awesome attitude made my day better :)

The guys at work rave about this place so I have it a try and won't be back. I got the crazy caprese sandwich which was ok.. but deff not worth $9 for 6 small slices of tomato and mozzarella on a sub. Taste was ok.. but just ok. Nothing amazing

OMG!!!!! No matter what you're feelin like, Sinful subs is amazing!!   Get loads of napkins and come with an appetite because you will enjoy every bite!! This is the kind of small business that becomes huge to the public with its incredible menu and service.  I cannot wait to go back and have their French onion soup that is to dye for and their sinful sub creations that knock it right out of the park with originality and excellent taste!! I deffinately come out of this little place full and content!!

On the way home, the wife and I discussed having a meatball sub. We went on yelp to see what was in the area. We went to the spot on Fort Apache after reading the reviews. No one was inside except the two people working so they could not rush things and should be a quality sandwich...in my mind. Well, it didn't quite work out so well. We received our 2 meatball subs and went home excited to try the food. The bread, cheese, sauce are phenomenal!! The meatballs not so much! They were dark on the entire outside part and didn't taste so good. Kind of a charred taste. I don't know if it's slmething they put on the meatballs as they initially cook it but it was not good. The inside was a lighter color and was a little better. I had no idea who the owner was until I went to look at reviews on Google. I'll go back to try something different but strike one. I'll update next time!

Oh my gosh so good!! I think this is my first 5 star review. I got the skinny dip which is like a french dip and philly cheesesteak combined. Best philly I've had, so cheesy and yummy. Bread they use is perfect. If it had mushrooms it would be 6/5. I will definitely come here instead of subway, firehouse, and all those other sub joints. 

Prices are around 9-10 for one but they fill them up. I got free funnel stix with a UNLV coupon which were also good. I recommend getting the fries instead of the potato salad, which was really bland and the potatoes were hard. The two workers inside were so lovely and nice. I think the female one was a manager. Be back soon for sure to try their other subs.

I am from Los Angeles and came out here for small getaway. Decided to order in, and I didn't want your regular delivery type food like pizza and Chinese. I found them on here so I decided to give them a try; and I am so happy I did! Their baller sub and knockout sub are delicious! Will definitely order from them again.
This is the best sandwich shop in Vegas. Unbelievable combinations in a yummy bun. It's off the strip and tucked back in a plaza across from UNLV. If I lived closer, I would eat there regularly.

One of the best sandwiches this fat guy has had in Vegas. I ordered a skinny dip, it's like a cheesesteak and a French dip and it was awesome. I really appreciated the bread that it came on, so many sub places have crappy bread. I was really intrigued by the meat styx and will have to come back again.

My new favorite sandwich shop in the entire world!   Try the meatstix which are meatloaf deep fried in a wonton served with gravy on the side for dipping.  I ordered the Tomato Mozzarella sandwich and it was truly the best.  The dig out some of the bread so that its like a bread tortilla, not this overwhelming "more bread than content".  A truly home made yummy place and everything is done to order, so be patient because your gonna be really happy!

Very welcoming. Cool atmosphere. Good to die for! They now have 8 subs. The meat sticks (meatloaf egg rolls) are SO good. The funnel cake sticks come w marshmallow sauce 10/10. The #2 was my favorite hands down!!

Stopped in on a Wednesday afternoon and it was very mellow and quiet as to be expected on a mid week,mid afternoon. The cashier taking orders was extremely sociable I regret not getting her name to give her credit for her help and personality. I'm not sure why I expected more to the atmosphere but either way it was fine. Now to the food! My kiddos shared the meatball sub (the baller) and it was pretty tasty! They in house make their own meatballs and marinara and you could definitely taste it! I got their signature the knuckle sandwich which is essentially their Italian sub... again super tasty. The subs were large and worth the price although a little disappointed for 10-12$ they don't come with a soft drink, only chips with an upgraded .99 fries which were so good and I suppose the quality of the sub makes up for the $2 drink it was lacking. They do have a loyalty program that gets you funnel fries served with homemade marshmallow dip just for signing up which was a pretty sweet deal to me! Thanks Vic for an awesome afternoon spot!

I could have easily put pastrami and cheese in the oven for cheaper and not have to drive 20 minutes out of my way. It was unimpressive inside. The guys ran to help the two young girls and left me waiting. I'd never go back here again. I'd rather go to Subway or just make a sandwich at home.

My daughter and I came here today to have their breakfast special. We were amazed by how good their New York breakfast sandwiches are. We got a special that comes with a sandwich, a hash brown and good coffee. All for only $6!!! The ambience is good. I like the music they play since its from my era. But if they want to attract the college students across the street, I suggest they play a variety of music, suitable for a younger generation. Overall this place is good. I will try their other sandwiches at a later day.

Delicious!  We ordered the knuckle and the skinny dip. Large portions of meat and great flavor!  We signed up for the rewards and got a free funnel fries. The side of fries were really good too!  We will definitely be back to try other sandwiches!

Amazing. Super fresh. Quality meats and cheese. The sub roll was soft and fresh. Perfectly topped with fresh veggies. I got the "Not so boring sub" Turkey. Sandwich comes with potato chips, which are more like round french fries. So good. Fast and friendly delivery. I will be back.

I don't know why everyone is raving about this place, because everything I tasted today was store bought product/ingredient. I opted for my first time to get the skinny dip sandwich and side salad. The side side for an additional $2, which is only basic romaine lettuce, and light add ins such as yellow ring chilies, small diced onions, and small chopped tomatoes. The dressing I chose was ranch, and I could tell was Hidden Valley Ranch. I was taken back it wasn't even a typical "restaurant ranch." I was completely unhappy he salad being so much extra for a basic small mixture. As for the sandwich, the meat was not bad with the auj dip, it was completely smothered in cheese that I could barley taste the meat. The roasted red peppers were so over powering because I could taste them as if they were a certain brand I know out of a jar. Nothing I had seemed to be actually prepared in the restaurant. 
I will give credit to them because I did see some employees rolling meatballs. The sub roll does look different so maybe they have a bakery custom make them? 
For a $10 sub, and $2 salad, I was expecting a lot more quality, and something made in house taste.

The name just sounded perfect to try. 
The food was good but way to much by myself and kinda expensive. Which if you don't eat right away gets soggy and useless. 
Most say the women who helped us was amazing because she was the only one I could see making use food and the cash register while the two men in the back was doing an order count or something.

Sinful subs. The name got me in. The experience was ok.  No one was inside when I got there. (Odd) the cashier was nice and helped me pick a sandwich I would enjoy. I got the club to the head sandwich.  

First thing size.  When are sandwich shops always making huge ass sandwiches?   The ingredients were fresh and good. Bread was nice and crunchy just tooooo big a sandwich. 

2nd cost: I think my total came out to 13 bucks which is expensive as hell for being across the street from a college. But hey had to try it out. Can't plug it and claim it knocked my socks off but I rather invest in a small business instead of McDonald's.

We've been wanting to try this place. Happy they moved SW. My son and I got the Skinny Dip and Rainy Day. The bread on the Skinny Dip has the perfect crisp. It was the perfect compliment to the au jus. My son loved his triple grilled cheese and tomato soup. I agree with some of the other reviews, bring your appetite. The fries are yummy. The funnel cake sticks and marshmallow sauce were super tasty. My only complaint is that I would have like to get them toward the end of my meal so we could enjoy them warm. The Stubborn sodas are an interesting flavor change up also. We will be back to try some different sandwiches.

Sinful Subs is just that...sinfully tasty!!! I like the decor but the real winner is the taste of the sandwich. The portions are plentiful and will fill you up. Make sure to come support this locally owned restaurant.

We've been here twice and love it. I've gotten the Knuckle twice and it get better and better. I want to try their meatball sub or the chicken parmesan next. The staff is very friendly and the lady who took our order the first even remembered us when we came the second time and she even remembered what my wife, my two children and my order. We will definitely be back. And I Strongly recommend Sinfully Subs
I got a pastrami sub the other day cuz I live behind them and it was fantastic I will be back! They were cool and friendly too! The sub was huge!!!! And delicious!

Second time visiting because the FLAVOR was so good the first time! Let's see, last visit I had a meatball sandwich and some deep fried meatloaf with gravy to dip into. This visit I'm having some French dip type sandwich, pretty good. My daughter is eating the pizza bread and enjoying it. My mom has the sandwich that resembles a Bobbie- she might be enjoying it but she's still eating the corn that came on top. If I know her she'll not get to the actual sandwich until I'm done with this sandwich. Food is tasty but get it delivered if comfort suits you- both times I've visited the air temperature is easily in the sixties indoors. That might be great if it's super hot outside and you've been melting all morning but it's not comfortable to eat in such a cold environment and if you aren't already wearing a jacket GOOD LUCK! The lady behind the counter seemed to turn the temp up when I came back in for forks and explained it was so cold we had to go outside to eat. In the shade. And it's only seventy three. You can imagine how cold it is inside? Anyway, that's twice I've been miserable while eating, not likely I'll forget the experience AGAIN and visit a third time. I might call for delivery but likely I'll just forget this place. You gotta be in touch with customers. I realize it gets warm when you are cooking but we aren't cooking, just trying to eat.

Was on our way to eat and saw this new sandwich shop. We decided to stop in and try it! So glad we did. Lady greeted us and answered all our questions. Great customer service from the start.  We shared the knuckle sandwich. It came with chips and we added on potato salad. It was delicious!! Can't wait to try all the sandwiches. 1 down 6 to go!!

Move over Capriotti's, here comes Sinful Subs. First visit today and I'll be a for sure regular when I'm on this side of town. The service was super friendly and helpful. Went with the recommended Skinny Dip. I was making yummy noises from the first bit! Good to the last bite. 9inch subs, but I was completely full by the end. So soft and cheesy, you don't even need the au jus you'll just want it for extra flavor. I will be back to try everything. The menu looks so creative and fun. Only one location in the sw off of Fort Apache, but totally worth the drive. sign up for the loyalty rewards for free and get funnel Styx desert right from the first visit!

Demish (spelling is prob totally wrong) she is an incredible employee. Very good asset to your business. Very knowledgeable with the menu, willing to go above and beyond and is always staying busy. Great hire!

Our first time here..The 'Baller' aka meatball sub is amazing! The coin fries have a great seasoning to them. I don't usually drink soda but they have a pineapple cream soda that is soooo yummy! We will be back to try more subs!
I loved it. My husband and I split a knuckle sandwich and it was delicious, toasted perfectly and tasty filling. It was very large so half was perfect for me.

CHOW DOWN! 
This place is incredible on all levels! 

Service: the employees are kind, funny, helpful and all around radical! 

Atmosphere: they stole the playlist from a mixed tape I made in 1989 of songs they played at the fair. All glam rock and power ballads. Gnarly af!

Food: holy mary mother of god (as the Goonies would say)! The food is impeccable, inconceivable, unbelievable! We had a large sampling of their menu including the cannoli and funnel cake sticks with marshmallow dipping sauce. Do it! 

I cannot recommended this place enough. It's really 5+ stars. Worth every stinkin' penny.

The sign leaving says, "you'll be back" and I promise you that is a fact!

Okay folks! Let's talk about sinful Subs! This place is really trendy and fun. They have different pictures of Las Vegas as the table tops. Their menu is fun! Each sandwich has its own name and they're just not limited to sandwiches. They have salads, mac and cheese, meatballs Etc. They also have a couple desserts. They have a chocolate chip cannoli and funnel cake fries! I also saw a fun onion soup. So they got a variety of things they also have a vegetarian dish. The place is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I chose to have there knuckle sandwich with fries and iced tea. Their knuckle sandwich is their 
 version of an Italian sandwich. Their fries are cottage fries and shaped as circles. The fries were very good crispy on the outside soft in the middle with a season all type of seasoning on it. It wasn't over seasoned and it wasn't under seasoned so it was just right. The knuckle sandwich comes out and it is a really good size sandwich. The bread is crispy on the outside as well as flaky and has a soft inside. Very good bread. They stuff it with the perfect amount of meat. Some places try to give you too much meat and some not at all. Sinful Subs had just the right amount. You felt like you were getting your money's worth and not being cheaped out. The meat was warm with cheese melted through it and It had this wonderful champagne vinaigrette that helped cut through some of the saltiness that comes from the meat. So was it real nice blend. I hate to tell you that I finished the whole sandwich. But I did! Not ashamed at all! I also finished the fries. But I left full and satisfied. I want to come back and try every single thing on the menu. I will be back! Good job sinful Subs! You rocked that sandwich and fries!

Great food and great service. I ordered the Italian Chick-N Vegas. And I was not disappointed at all. Also great drink selection big time. And the fries are chips style. You'll definitely get your moneys worth big time. I'll be coming back for sure. Hope you folks check out this little hidden and enjoy it.
Just tried the knuckle sandwich and it was amazing everything on the menu looks amazing I say amazing so many times but it's amazing.  If you are a sandwich person you are going to love this place
Food was descent. Not extraordinary but not bad. Going to return to try again and see if another sandwich is really good.

Had a Groupon for this place so decided to try it out. Went on a Monday around 4:30, nobody was there. We ordered the jive turkey sub & got it quick. Staff was friendly even gave me a free drink. The sandwich was very good gravy very tasty & mashed potatoes. Overall good experience sandwich's are a little on the pricey side but portions are generous so keep that in mind. Check this place out they got a Groupon deal for two $10 vouchers for 10 dollars.
Burnt meatballs dry, felt nasty afterwards. Didn't care for it customer service was okay food wasn't worth price
Amazing stop on our trip! Great food and customer service. They made a special sandwich for my picky daughter. I'll be back next time we drive thru.

Fun and high quality local sub shop by Vic "Vegas" Moea.  Staff was very friendly and had great customer service.  Reasonable prices for high quality subs with interesting menu choices.  Had 'The Baller' and 'Broken Fingers' - both were fresh and 'The Baller' in particular was homemade quality.  'Stack of Coin' fries were well seasoned and cooked very well.

This is exactly the type of home grown business I like to see in Las Vegas - for locals and by locals, with an emphasis on high quality and creative food very accessible to all, with friendly service - a business that Las Vegas locals need to patronize and support in expanding local cuisine.

So freaking good! From the second I saw the pictures of the Knuckle Head Sub and the Club to the Head, I knew that's what we needed! Delivery was pretty quick, I wish she would have waited for me to get her a tip!

Came in and noticed the guests in front of us didn't get their food together. But then neither did we. 

One time could be a mistake. Twice in a row tells me something systemically is wrong. 

Won't be back.
They got new workers and they're extremely rude! The cashier Karyn responded to every question I asked was an eye roll and a ton of attitude.
"The cannoli Tasted like Satan came in my mouth and it was amazing !! " food was soooo good better than firehouse , Capriotti's ! Definitely recommend this place !!
Greatly exceeded expectations!! Went looking for another restaurant that was closed so stopped in here and will be coming back soon!! Their skinny dip sandwich is worth every penny!

Place is new...I get it. The lady taking our order didn't know how to use the system. That, I understand. I ordered the "Rainy Day" which is grilled cheese and tomato soup. I subbed the kettle chips for fries. My husband ordered the "Skinny Dip" which is basically their take on a French Dip sandwich. He subbed the chips for fries as well. Paid for it...seemed overpriced, but whatever - maybe it would be worth it. Looked at the receipt and she charged me for large fries and my husband for small fries. It's $2.99 to upgrade to large fries and $0.99 for small. Yeah, thanks for asking. So we wait for our food and when we get it, my large fries aren't even on there. So she gets it and then we start eating. Before I take a bite, I look at my grilled cheese and the cheese is clearly not melted. I take a bite where it doesn't look cold and it was cold. Even dipping it in the tomato soup didn't help. The fries were VERY over-seasoned and salty. I didn't bother saying anything. The French Dip has a bitter aftertaste. Not coming back. If you decide to try this place, don't get the "Rainy Day" and if you get something else and sub it for fries, ask them not to season it.

So, a guy came in to my place of business passing out menus. As soon as I opened it, my mouth started watering profusely as I looked over the pictures. A bunch of us ordered and none of us were disappointed! I split the Skinny Dip and No Sin Salad with one of my co-workers. And it was to die for! So delicious + so tasty! Price is reasonable. delivery guy was super friendly.  I haven't got a bad thing to say about my first experience. They'll be getting a lot of orders from me!
Had the Skinny Dip yesterday. Disappointed. For $11 I expected a larger sub and more meat. Tasted good but when I got to the end of the sub there was no meat. Not worth the $
Best sub I've had, maybe ever!!!! This will be a staple of mine going forward!!! The Knucklehead was soooo good and a hearty helping as well!!! Go here

7 Sinful Subs is definitely sinful you could end up in hell or jail just for eating "The Italian Chix-in Vegas". 
A hand breaded chicken cutlet home made marinara. 
Don't eat this after dark its a evil chicken parmesan.  
"The Jive Turkey".
 ATTENTION NEWS AT 7 " The Jive Turkey just Beat the Sh** out of the Bobbie right in front of UNLV. 
( what's a Bobbie?) Well its Dead to me.This sandwich not only has slow roasted turkey, stuffing, cranberry, but it also has mashed potatoes and a nibble of corn on the cob.
 the "Skinny Dip". Was so good i ate it with my clothes on. It was delicious. There is nothing skinny about this French Dip.
The "Meat Styx" are delicious slices of home made meat loaf wrapped in a egg roll they come with gravy for dipping.
  I could swim in the gravy it's perfect to dip my meat styx in.
If you'd like to get punched in the mouth go here and ask for a "Knuckle Sandwich". Its a awesome grilled Italian sub.
For dessert "Funnel Styx" yummy little sticks of funnel cake with a marshmallow dipping sauce.

 If your tired of the same old sandwiches for lunch 
This is a great place to be a Sinner. 
                          
            "Everybody else is doing it" ha ha ha

Outstanding sandwich,  Skinney Dip, pure heaven. Wish I could have eaten two more, but one was enough for dinner last night. Quaint atmosphere and curtious service. Can't wait to be in the area again.
Had the baller and the skinny dip since they were recommended! Damn delicious great atmosphere and excellent service! Officially new sandwhich spot!
A little pricy and empty at noon on a Sunday. Should have went to burger joint. I had the no. 2.

Huge disappointment. I looked on yelp and saw they had almost 5 stars so I was excited to try them out. Ordered the "club to the head" sandwich and got an old bread roll, stuffed with dry turkey, and a pound of lettuce on top. The sandwich was dry and none of the ingredients tasted fresh. I was starving and still could barely finish half. Never again.

Hands down my favorite sandwich in Vegas. I work close by so come here a couple times a week for lunch. Have tried most of the menu and haven't had a bad sandwich yet. My favorite is the Skinny Dip. Unreal how good it is. Highly recommend trying it if you're here for your first time. Their fries are awesome too and staff is friendly. All around quality place, give it a look.

Ordering from Eat24 for was very simple.  The food was ready when I got there.  We ordered The Baller with potato salad & The Skinny Dip with chips.  The subs were delish, but the sides were just average.

I was going to give 2 stars, but gave 3 because the employee's were welcoming and nice. But if it was just rating my chicken parm sub, it'd be 2. 1st, my chips were not in my container. 2nd, the chicken had a horrible texture/consistency to it-like rubbery. Kind of like it was microwaved or something. I couldn't eat it. But the bread (probably steak roll from Great Buns bakery) was tasty, and the sauce and cheese were also good. I will probably give this place 1 more chance, since I work close to it, but definitely won't be ordering chicken.

Got one of the last subs out of this location Monday night.  They're moving to a bigger, nicer location about 3 miles to the east and will offer beer.   Happy to see them open 2.0.

Had a chance to chat with the manager for a bit about how it all started and what their future plans are(which are bright).

Bread was nicely toasted, loaded with meat and too good not to finish.  When they reopen in January I suggest anyone reading look up the new address and give them a try!

I have had atleast three different sandwiches of theirs and all of them were great. I love the coin fries and the potato salad. Also, the ghost pepper sauce is to die for (literally). The staff is friendly and the customer service is impecible. I'll continue to come back here for my lunch breaks.

I have been a fan of this place of this place since it was across from the UNLV campus.  They have nearly perfected the Earl of Sandwich's most famous creation.  Paraphrasing an old commercial, "this isn't a sandwich, this is a manwich."  A lot of sandwich shops are all bread, no meat.  This shop is just the opposite, all meat and then some.  The sandwiches are Andre the Giant sized and just as unique.  My favorite  is the T.V. dinner.  The mashed potatoes are the star of this production.  I have had nearly every sandwich on the menu and all of them are great.  Unfortunately, there is only one of these shops in town.  That may change in the near future.  I was asking them if they are going to expand and they are looking to expand to both Summerlin and Henderson.  They hope to be in both neighborhoods in the very near future.  This will make the world a better place for everyone.  I strongly suggest you ask them to double down on your sandwich.  This is when they double the meat for three dollars more.  Trust me you will hit the jackpot each time.
Absolutely phenomenal subs- everything is made from scratch and so damn good!!!  Must eat when in LV!  Favs are Skinny Dip and Knuckle Sandwich!!  Great atmosphere and very kind and caring staff!

Went for the grand opening and found our new sandwich shop! What an amazing place. The owners are awesome, the staff is excellent, and the food...let me tell you about the food! Got the broken fingers to snack on and it is some of the best chicken I have ever tasted...an appetizer is the best chicken I have had! The chicken parm sandwich, skinny dip, and the trail-errr dog were all amazing. Not too many places have something for the whole family but Sinful Subs has it all!! Cant wait to go back and try even more!
Alright. This place is different. It's GOOD. It's about a dollar overpriced for a sub 10.49 for just the sandwich will keep me from returning often.

Ok, just got back from the Official Grand Opening and all I can say is OMG, Chef Vic continues to live up to the high standards he sets. Everything was outstanding. If you have not tried this place you have got to put it on your bucket list. I normally do not like subs with dressing on them but the Knuckle Head may be my favorite. Will see after I try more.

I had a ridiculous craving for a cheesesteak, I came here because of the awesome reviews.. I ordered the skinny dip without peppers and substituted raw onions, saut√©ed onions just don't do it for me. I love French dips and I love cheesesteaks.. this was a combination of the two. the flavor was good, not out of this world, didn't really subdue my craving but it was tasty. 

Other reviews mentioned the huge portions but I disagree, it was an average sized sandwich. I upgraded to seasoned fried potato coins, they were tasty, needed to be crispier but still tasted good. There are other sandwiches that look good that I will come back to try another time

How can you go wrong with a band like this?  Had the turkey and ham.  Very good. The bread was so soft and melted in your mouth. They do sand which to your liking, much better than the chain locations.

Got the Philly cheesesteak, and it was delicious. Fresher ingredients are used and they cook everything correctly. Reason for the 3 stars is $11 and change for a sandwich is insane in the membrane! It's the same size sandwich as a jersey mikes sub, so it's not bigger than most. If you don't mind the price, I highly recommend this place! Love seeing the small chains succeed.
Very friendly owners and staff. Great subs. Great location. I had the meatball it was heavenly!

Thanks Yelp for this great find. And as a bonus it's only a few doors always from my favorite boba place in Las Vegas. The customer service here is awesome, the girl at the register explained the menu to us and everything on it she was really helpful, nice and friendly. Off the menu this is what we order the skinny dip sub and the baller sub, we spilt  both subs I got half of the skinny dipper and half of the Baller. Both subs where good but I like the skinny dipper the most, the grilled sirloin was juicy with saut√©ed onions and red peppers and was baked in their oven with American cheese, the cheese was melted on there and the bread was toasted just right. The baller had hand made meatballs made on the spot baked in the oven also with mozzarella cheese. Not to much of a meatball person but the Aller was pretty good. The sub come with these quarter size potatoes kind of like french fries pretty good.there's plenty of seating and the place is clean. I will be back when I'm in Las Vegas craving one of these sinful subs.

Wow. If it's a sin to eat here, then reserve my seat in hell because I'm definitely coming back to try everything on the menu. I just happened to see this place, while going to another store and I figured why not? Jesus Christ, the sandwich I had was heavenly. I got the "Walk o' Shame." It's a breakfast sandwich made out of triple decker french toast with eggs, cheese, sausage, hash browns and half a pig worth of ham, served with a side of syrup. It was huge and was cooked perfectly. It's only served on weekends, probably due to the shortage of pigs in the area. Seriously though, the menu isn't gigantic but everything has flair and looks like it'll taste amazing. See ya guys soon. The meatballs are calling my name!!!
Got a knuckle sandwich!! Amazing, no served like a traditional sub. But absolutely delicious. Also got a free soda for wearing a knights hat!! Go Knights Go!!

These house made meatball subs are great. I recently ate at Rao's at Caesars and think these balls could match Rao's  in a Taste test. Maybe food tastes different when it comes with historical cache and mood lighting, but in this case, I don't feel a need to go to Rao's if I can go here instead.

The service was great. In the USA cheery service is a given, but here it didn't seem forced. Guess that goes with it being an owner operated place.

The other sub we tried was also well made.

I am going to come back one weekend morning to try their monster french toast weekend special. I'll have to bring a friend or two, otherwise I will be asleep as soon as leave the place.
Staff were very friendly and helpful! Sandwiches are a good size (9 inches), unique and delicious.

I usually don't hate myself enough to be one of those people who actually leave yelp reviews but I just gotta say, this was hands down the best sandwich I've ever had. If you're looking for a $5 footlong then go somewhere else but if you want a classic quality built sandwich then this is the place to go.

So happy I found this place... Thanx YELP (you never let my taste buds down). I've had 3 of the 7 unique sandwiches, would like to try the others... BUT it's tough to move away from the Knuckle or Jive Turkey. They are so good!

And the management/staff really know how to make a person feel welcome.

My wife tried this place the other day. She works at Squeeze In and passes by this place all the time. So, why not try a new place??

The decor was cool. Clean and inviting inside. Plenty of parking. As we entered there was a huge display of the menu. My wife ordered the Caprese sandwich & Mac and Cheese. 

The portion was perfect. The mozzarella was flavorful and the sandwich itself was yummy. The only reason we took off one star is because of the wait. The lady told us it'll be 10-15min wait due to a big order before ours. 

Would I try this place again? Yes. Would I recommend? Yes.

We came because I saw a post on Facebook.  We ordered Skinny Dip which was amazing, we also ordered Krusty Mac it was decent and I especially enjoyed the Funnel Styx.  So all in all really good sandwiches decent price worth another visit.

A friend of mine was raving about this place, so I decided to check it out.  Boy, was I disappointed :(  My sandwich was drowning in a thick layer of melted cheese, but had barely any meat or veggies accompanying it.  The jus to dip it in tasted strange, so I only used it a couple of times.  I didn't feel well the rest of the day.  Not going to fit this place into my sandwich shop rotation anytime soon.

I have been here a few times over the last few months, and slowly over time, the service has just gone down hill. Ever since their "grand opening", months after they moved into this spot, the people are less friendly. Tonight was the last time we'll be going there. The woman behind the counter looked like she wanted to be anywhere else but there, and made that very clear while taking our order. We were going to eat there but man, turn in the AC! It's 105 outside and 90 inside...not the place you want to eat a steaming hot sandwich. We asked to change our order to take out and the guy behind the counter didn't speak, just nodded and stood there. Finally he went to tell the kitchen and about 5 minutes later, that same unpleasant woman called our number, dropped our meals on the counter and walked away. Not a thank you or even a nod. If you hate your job that much, find a new one! I will never go back. Turn on your AC for God's sake and hire people who can actually smile and talk to other humans!
SINFULLY DELICIOUS!! so glad reopened to a new location in the southwest!! they also have a new menu. the serving you get is totally worth the price!!

Slammin', jammin', so good, so fresh...DAMN!  I literally had to defend my skinny dip from my hubby's wandering grasp. I brought the entire family here after a show at UNLV and I'm so glad I did. This was the epitome of delicious. If you like sandwiches, don't miss this spot. Their potato chips are a refreshing chance of pace from the usual fries. Try this place, and as thanks, you can bring me back for a sandwich on your second trip. I'm not so greedy that I'll make you do it for every trip thereafter. I guarantee you'll want more. We all know the best have roots in Vegas!  You're welcome!  Please bring one over to the west side!
I absolutely love the concept of this sub shop! Tasty and creative subs at a great price. I am literally obsessed with the cannolis here! They are a must have!

Bruh!!! How is this even legal? I got the pastrami bomb and I'm debating on whether or not I'm going to make it to my car. I live in the neighborhood so this could get dangerous. They have a huge spread of hot sauces( including bacon). My only suggestion would be to replenish them. It look like a condiment graveyard in the section.  I probably would've cured / grilled the pastrami a little longer but it was definitely still a great sandwich. I'm good on eating for like a day.

First time in on a recommendation from a co worker and my god was I blown away! Order the number two! I love French dips and philly cheese steaks. When I saw them combined, the choice was a no brainer. It was amazing! Mac & cheese was good but not really a must try.

Great sub shop very friendly and helpful girl at the counter made sure we loved our subs and had the TVs on the knights game and the basketball games great subs can't wait to go back try more and great customer service

Hahaha why the hell pay 15 bucks a person for sandwiches on the strip that are hyped and mediocre at best when all you have to do is go a mile and eat here. Best damn meatball sammich and turkey bacon sammich we ever did eat. And we've eaten some damn sammiches.  Vic definitely has his touch on these sandwiches. Perfect size and bread is bomb.

This place is different and delicious! They have a bunch of mind blowing concoctions from sharables, soups & salads, desserts, & of course some super bomb sandwiches!!! Friendly staff and it's very clean!!!

Went the other night to get a Knuckle Sandwich.  Since I had never been there before, I decided to go and order at the counter and wait to take it home to eat it.  The staff was very friendly, welcoming, and the sandwich was outstanding.  I can't wait to go back and try more.  Definitely a great place to check out.
Happy Employees, Excellent Food! Check it out! Upscale Subs, amazing appetizers. Cannolis are to die for!

My boyfriend is an avid sandwich lover so after many recommends from others, we decided to check this place out. The vibe is super 1980's metal and it's located in a strip mall across the street from Walmart. Once you walk you order at the counter and they call out your number when it's ready. 

We decided to share the Crazy Caprese sub (vegetarian friendly) and some fries. The sub was enough for us to share along with a side. I loved the toasted bread. It was cooked to perfection. The toppings were plentiful, but I do wish it had a traditional balsamic rather than the clear Italian dressing it had. Overall it was still very tasty. The fries were great. They reminded me of my childhood and were perfectly cooked. I also indulged in a giant pickle, so tasty!

I will most likely be back again and hopefully they add some more vegetarian options. Rock on Sinful Subs!

This place is super cool!! Nice vibe inside and the team is very courteous!  The sandwiches are huge and fresh!!! Come here and you will never go to any of those chain places again!!  I assure you, D E L I S H!

They recently moved to the southwest from UNLV area. The menu looks really good, but the taste is just average. I really liked how quick the service was and some of their decore. However, the taste of their food was disappointing. The lettuce did not look fresh which made the sandwich less appealing. Their pricing is also a bit higher than most sandwich places based on the quality of the items. Overall, a very average place.

Very filling, come hungry. These are basically comfort foods crammed into a fresh baked hoagie roll. Everything seems fresh made or from scratch. Takes a few extra minutes to get your food... But then again this was also their first day open at the new location.

I got to try the Skinny Dip (their take on a French Dip Sandwich) and the Pastram-Bomb. I really liked the Skinny Dip, the Pastrami was top notch, but I would have liked it better without the smooshed fries inside. I mean it was good, just didn't expect it.

Next time I order, I'm going with their Not-So-Boring Sub, which is basically a build it how you like it sub.

I got an order of Funnel Styx... Oh man... Sooo good! This is a reason for me to come back. It's like having fair food in a nice clean setting, with a mild Rock-a-Billy vibe.
food was amazing!!! The cannolis were excellent also. Service was on point.  be back soon.  thanks

Went and got the skinny dip which came with potato chips. I wanted fries instead so i paid extra (think it's was $1 ish) which is kinda surprising because the sandwhich alone was over priced ($11) and i literally got like 7 fries. I asked for a glass for water and he cashier hands me a glass and points the fountain drinks, thanks. I look at the receipt and he charged for for the water, which was the price of a fountain drink ($2ish).

We ordered food to be delivered which I thought would be a little bit hotter because we only live 2 blocks away from the restaurant but it wasn't that hot and I ordered extra Ranch because those fries really need Ranch and I did not get the extra Ranch that I paid for , but other than that the broken fingers were very good .My husband said the sandwich was okay (not wonderful) he got the number 4 Turkey  and he said the potato salad was one of the worst ones he ever had, which was surprising because she said they hand made everything, but I think they need to work on the potato salad.It is basically little squares of potatoes with a very runny white sauce over it kind of like  white water in the smallest side container I ever saw..He said the cannoli was "just ok" too. Not sure why all this is so mediocre when it's all handmade, but we will give it at least one more try. Next time I will go to the restaurant instead of having it delivered so it will be hot food....

It's nice that they are right across the street from UNLV but it looks like they are moving to different located on 12/9/17. Based on the reviews on Yelp, I decided to order the 'Skinny Dip w/ mac and cheese.' It took about 10 minutes for to sub to be ready so that was good. Portion looks regular not really large as describe by others although I did get filled with half of the sandwich. I love mac and cheese but this one just didn't have any flavor, it was also lukewarm so that wasn't great. The sub itself smelled amazing but it was missing something since it didn't have the flavor of philly cheesesteak. The food was okay but for the price.... I expected something a little better.

Alright. So this was suggested for dinner, but at the time i just was not feeling it.  Finally though on Sunday afternoon we wake up groggy as hell and just needing some food. Deciding on a place that was unique to Vegas.  I remember this suggestion from a few nights ago and everyone agrees. Well off we go. Added bonus it was .2 miles away from where we were staying. 

Walk in and oh my goodness do these subs look good. Cashier asks if its our first time and we say yeah it is.  He hands us some menus to look at and lets us take our time.  A few of us had some questions and he was super patient and answered all of them.  My turn to order.  The Not So Boring Sub. Oh man was that good stuff.  I got mine with a side of their Stack O Coins.  One of my friends ordered the Walk Of Shame and dear lord... We spent 5 minutes just talking about that sandwich after he got it.  Not only was their food great, but they have maybe 40 hot sauces just lined up.  From all over the place. I did not get one but it was cool to just see their collection.

Will i go again? Yes.

PS I am allergic to gluten and I would still go again.

One word to describe this place: "Deliciousness"!

7 sinful subs with out a doubt has some of the best sandwiches in Vegas! 

True to its name, there are 7 subs on the menu with one sandwich served only on the weekends. The flavor and quality of these sandwiches with out a doubt make this place a hit! 

The sandwiches are already stacked but if you are really hungry, you can double down and let me tell you, yikes come with a big appetite because they are well served and you will struggle to finish the sandwich.

This place looks really cool inside with all the decor,... I mean flames on the wall! and classic rock playing, come on... that's freaking cool! 

So boys and girls if you want to taste one of the best sandwiches you'll ever have, try a sandwich from 7 sinful subs, you won't be disappointed.

Good. Better than subway. More creative than capriottis (I might have spelled that wrong). The sandwiches are filling. Maybe, I just didn't get all the hype. I like the sandwiches, I just wasn't wowed.

Bombdigity!!! Cheesy, melty, stringy, crusty subs! What more could you ask for? Service is excellent! Waited for a bit because it's their first day opening this location but men, was it worth the wait! I got the Skinny Chic, my daughter got the Italian Chic N Vegas, and my other got the Rainy Day (Ultimate Grilled Cheese with Tomato Soup), and men oh men. This is cheat day food!

Very different sandwich shop. 
Every sandwich has a unique name and the bread is super soft and fluffy. They roll of the sandwich is a must. I think price wises could be cheaper. But make I don't know what it takes to make that delicious bun they use to make my sandwich. I will try a different one next time hope to become a regular. 
Customer service could improve not very tentative but the food is amazing.

Waited 5 minutes for someone to acknowledge I was there.  And she came straight from cleaning the restroom, without washing her hands.  And after taking our order, she took out trash and then straightened up all the condiment bottles, still without washing hands.  It just grossed me out and couldn't enjoy the sandwich.  Sandwich was ok, but I don't know how you're out of meatballs?  And it's summertime, please turn on the AC.

Now that Zydecos closed downtown, this may be the best sub in Las Vegas. Fries are exceptional as well. You should try this place. But I'll warn ya that it is especially sinful. No healthy side options available and no wheat buns or lettuce wraps. This is a place you go on cheat days. And you won't regret it!
If I could give this place 6 stars I would. Super fresh, super friendly staff, quality and taste beats out every other sub place in Las Vegas

Right across from UNLV SU. Friendly service. Sub took about 5-7 minutes to come out, not bad. Was told to get the most popular -Skinny dip. Flavor was ok, nothing special. It's like a hybrid French dip and philly steak. Was toasted a bit too long. Overall could've been executed a little better. Mac n cheese was good but fairly standard. 
3.5/5

Have come here a few times finally decided to write a review. The subs are delicious. Had the Walk o shame once and the trailer. Both were awesome.  Some different options compared to regular sandwich spots.  Definitely recommend it.
This sub location offered fun friendly subs that were unique and different to every once taste and cravings.  The staff was great here the food was wonderful and I will return soon.

Heard the commercials all week and was excited to try. Husband ordered the knuckle sand which was amazing! I was craving a chicken park sand and ordered the chick-en Vegas. Got our sandwiches and the chicken was so rubbery. Not eatable. The chick-en Vegas was easily replaced with a Baller instead, which was great! I will say they need better sides to accommodate these amazing subs. The "coins" are not on par with their subs. Maybe some coleslaw or potato salad... Anything besides chips.

7 Sinful Subs replaced iCheese Pizza. While I'm sad to see iCheese go, I was excited to try a new sub place. I swung by on a lunch break with two friends to try the infamous Meat Hater. Suck it meat subs! 

MEAT HATER ($8.99): Vegetarians rejoice! It's a huge sub loaded with squash, zucchini, mozzarella, and roasted red peppers. Half was honestly enough, but since it's dubious this sub would be good as leftovers (what with the vinaigrette and lettuce), I'd say it's better to smash the whole thing in one sitting. 4/5

STACK O' CHIPS: Thin-ish potato rounds with seasoning. Soft and flavorful. All subs come with a choice of either these potato things or potato salad. Cool kids get the stack o' chips. Plus, the potato salad serving was rather tiny. 4/5 

Students get a free fountain drink. Score! Wait times are a bit long, but the food is generally worth the wait. The hair metal soundtrack made the wait time more pleasant. All in all, 7 Sinful Subs is a welcome addition to the UNLV community.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #59

Items Selected:
Jive Turkey - Oven Roasted Turkey, Stuffing, Mashed Potatoes, Corn on the Cob, Cranberry Sauce, Gravy
Italian Chick-en Vegas - Hand Breaded Chicken Cutlet, Housemade Marinara, Melted Mozzarella
Walk o' Shame - Triple Decker Cinnamon French Toast, Fried Eggs, Sausage Patties, Bacon, Grilled Ham, American Cheese, Cream Cheese, Hash Browns, Powdered Sugar, Syrup and a Fruit Cocktail
Black Chip Cannoli - Chocolate Dipped with Mascarpone and Dark Chocolate Chips

Originally titled Seven Sinful Subs, but since expanding that idea to a few more sandwiches and dropping the number, Vic Vegas' Sinful Subs on Maryland Parkway originally opened its doors just under one year ago and although a bit tucked away in one of the shopping centers near UNLV a late lunch on Saturday showed the product to be far better than one might guess from the outside signage or website.

Officially located at 4632 South Maryland Parkway, nearby businesses including the expected head shops, a US Post Office and other grab n' go dining ideas, it was just past 2:00pm that online ordering was accessed by way of the website and perusing the choices with a coupon in hand the decision was made to order three Sandwiches plus one Dessert, the quoted preparation time of forty-five minutes a little hard to believe and a quick call to the restaurant suggesting this was automated, a ten minute drive finding 2/3 of the items already hot, ready and waiting.

Now open for Breakfast six-days a week, the upcoming semester not yet in session and things still fairly quiet, it was with M√∂tley Cr√ºe's Kickstart My Heart playing overhead that the store was entered, a lengthy space decorated in flames and pictures of menu choices traversed en route to a counter set next to the kitchen, a trio of servers all pleasant and hard at work slicing Deli-meat, frying Chicken and assembling what would turn out to be several to-go orders plus some food for another duo of dine-in patrons.

Certainly not an upscale spot, the soundtrack next transitioning to Metallica's Seek and Destroy before some KISS, it was with one Sandwich plated while the rest was boxed to go that a seat along one wall was taken, the "Nosebleed Seats" as good a place as any to tuck into a dastardly combination entitled "Walk o' Shame" that sees three thick slices of Cinnamon and Custard seared French Toast wrapped around two Eggs, crispy Bacon, Ham, Fennel Sausage, two types of Cheese and Hashbrowns, all of it exactly as ridiculous as it sounds and best eaten disassembled as the whole is really no better or worse than the sum of its parts.

Chuckling at the Fruit Cocktail served alongside the Sandwich, a variety of Chips or upgraded sides such as Macaroni and Cheese offered alongside other Sandwiches, it was with Hot Cheetos packed up for the lady that both the Jive Turkey and Italian Chick-en Vegas were next given a taste while still warm, the former clearly a riff on Capriotti's famous "The Bobbie" but bettered by way of a toasty Roll, Mashed Potatoes and Gravy plus Cranberry Sauce on the side while the Parm was on par with many local sit-down restaurants thanks to a hand-breaded and fried-to-order Cutlet topped in housemade Marinara and melted Mozzarella.

Admittedly intrigued by The Baller and its housemade Meatballs as well as the bargain New York Breakfast Sandwich on a Kaiser Roll with Coffee and Hashbrowns for just $6 it was instead with Dessert that the meal came to a conclusion, Vic's family recipe Cannoli a bit disappointing in that it had clearly been pre-filled with some notable sog, though the Chocolate dip and Chips did help a little bit with both flavor and consistency.

***1/2:Sort of an overwrought concept, though executed far better than it need be given the location, Sinful Subs offers several unique and hearty Sandwiches as a price that is a bit higher than the Chains but justified by good customer service and far better ingredients, plus the obvious support of a local business.

Very quality meatball sub (the Baller) coming out of this joint!! My wife and I split one but I definitely could have taken down my own. Great 80's butt rock playing on the speakers and a nice selection of (somewhat) healthier sodas....would definitely recommend and we'll be back to try their other subs!!

I wish i could give 10 starts for customer service alone . Every single employee had amazing hospitality . As soon as we walked in we were immediately greeted & asked if we were first time customers. You honestly don't get that often and that little gesture can go a long way . The female employee who helped take our order & also made our meal made sure to satisfy whatever we were craving.

We ended up getting broken fingers , the French dip type sandwich , & the funnel cake . OMG BOMBB . Were def going to return.

All in all , top notch food , but the customer service made the biggest impression for me . People like feeling noticed & with our service we definitely were treated how every customer should be treated ..

Thanks 7 sinful subs . Will def be returning

Very clean place! Very friendly staff ...food was amazing! Sandwiches are very big so consider sharing. Knuckle Head was so flavorful..the Club to the Head was very good... One of our party had the special pizza bread..he was pleased too...Mac and cheese was a great hit!

This was the worst sandwiches I've ever had in my life. The we're made like crap. Cashier was okay just rushing me to order young man making the sandwiches is very immature. Will never purchase this deal off groupon again. Outrageous, prices for anything in this place. Small portion you pay 2.00 for double meat tgey don't put it on. You ask for fries you get 10 flat potatoe shaped ones. Just a really bad experience  won't b e vack. I've enclosed photos too. Shame on them. No wonder why they were empty.
the funnel cake fries are yummy. the sandwich portions are hearty. friendly staff. good place to bring kids with hearty appetites

The sandwiches here are creative and delicious!  I love anything with au jus so naturally I went for the skinny dip.  The meat, cheese, the bread, the au jus....everything was packed with flavor.  The bread is the perfect consistency with just a little crunch on the exterior but soft as you bite into it.  For lighter eaters, I suggest splitting a sandwich.  I ended up eating the filling after eating half because my eyes started getting droopy already from the amount of bread.  The fries here are not your normal fries, they are seasoned crinkle cut potato slices.  The fries are nice and crispy on the outside but still soft on the inside.  Very addicting...I was full but kept eating these.  The broken fingers were also really flavorful, but perhaps not my favorite since I'm pretty sure they are made with white meat chicken.  The mac cheese was really good as well, very creamy and saucy. We also ordered the funnel cake stix with the marshallow creme.  These things are dessert heaven.  Anytime I'm craving some carbs, this is where I'll be.

One of my favorite places to have a great sub. I am a big fan of Vic Vegas and I was so disappointed when his restaurant the High Roller Deli closed. So I was super excited when I found out about 7 Sinful Subs. The cleverly named subs are delicious and I love the atmosphere. My favorite sub so far is The Baller, a sub stacked with some large homemade meatballs and marinara. Everyone that works there is nice and welcoming. So glad to have Vic back in business. I plan on being a regular here, coming in at least once a week.

I ordered a "club to the head" and was full after eating 1/2 of it, but couldn't stop eating and finished the whole thing because it was so ridiculously tasty!! 

Staff was very friendly and even walked our food to the table. We will be back soon!

Wow! The food is delicious! You can tase the fresh ingredients! We tried the chicken parm sandwich and the pastrami sandwich! They were both very flavorful. The sandwiches are large and filling. Glad to see Vic Vegas' food is closer to where we live. We will definitely be back!

Put that subway and or cappriottis down! Get in your car and drive here. This place is the number one sub shop in Las Vegas. East Coast inspired brought to the West Coast! Amazing subs and flavors that will keep you coming back for more!

Came to Sinful Subs for dinner this evening. It was our first time here and we were excited and eager to try the food. The decoration was fun and humorous, the music a little loud since the sound bounces off. As we approached to order and were looking at the menu, there was an employee that seemed angry. She told us "this will be to go since we close in 10 minutes," in a rude tone. We felt rushed to order, unwelcome, and practically kicked out, but ordered anyway. I realized that there was no welcome, goodbye, or thank you. When we finally arrived at home, I was disappointed with my philly and round fries. Not only was the service unfriendly, but the food and the prices weren't that great either.

This place should get TEN stars!  Hubby and I ate lunch here today, it was our first time.  Greeted by Paulette and immediately felt right at home, she is very friendly and polite!  We split a Skinny Dip and upgraded to the side salad.  The bleu cheese dressing is awesome.  The sub was delicious and very filling!  Chatted with another customer, he goes there all the time and said every. single. thing. on the menu is fabulous.  Guess we will go back for lunch again tomorrow, I can't stop thinking about how GREAT the food is here!

We came all the way from SC to eat here because I am a big fan of Vic Vegas. Needless to say, it did not disappoint, and the food was delicious. We tried the #2 (skinny dipper) and #5 (the baller) and split them, and they were insanely good! We also tried the funnel cake dippers for dessert and they were crispy and light. Would recommend this place for anyone in the Vegas area or just visiting!

Amazing subs!! Tried the Club on the Head sandwhich, which was delicious. My friend had the Knuckle sandwhich which was also incredible. We had a groupon, and they were able to accept it with no problems. We got our sandwiches, and then Jeff (I think he's a part owner) brought over a cannoli to us, which was delicious, and so so so sweet of him to do!!! He also gave me a water bottle free of charge. Super sweet guy, and the meal was incredible! Definitely coming back.

In a hangry moment I decided to come here. I ordered the skinny dip and the pastrami bomb. The sandwiches came out quickly..... perfect for a hangry lady. The skinny dip was reallllllyyyyyy delicious (unless it was one of those hangry moments where I imagined how good the food was but it was really bad). The fries were hot and seasoned well. The side salad left room to be desired and the pastrami was well flavored but a little blahzay compared to the skinny dip.... at least in my opinion. The service was subpar and the price was a little steep. Therefore, I feel 4 stars is suitable. I'd go back to try more of the adventurous sandwiches. However, I definitely agree with all my fellow helpers that they are slightly over priced.

I enjoyed the Italian chicken-vegas sub and fries. Their name for a chicken parmesan sandwich. The portions are great for the price and everything is made to order. Even so, it comes out fresh and delicious.

Great subs, just not for vegetarians! I also loved how committed they are to the theme, and that their menu is very specialized, rather than cluttered. Review as follows ~

Service: 5/5
Everyone was super friendly and helpful! I initially thought it took a little while to get our food, but it's definitely not the kind of sandwich you get Subway or Capriotti's. It's a meal, and they pay attention to every order. 

Pricing: 4.5/5
$9 for a sandwich is a little steep, but the portions are huge and they come with fries or potato salad. It would probably be more reasonable to skim a dollar off the price of the sandwich, and then opt in for a meal, but oh whale 

Food:
Skinny Dip: 4.5/5
My boyfriend loved this sandwich, and it looked amazing. This not so skinny sandwich was loaded up with melted, gooey cheese. He said it was one of the better French onion dip sandwiches he's ever had, and he will definitely be back.

Meat Hater: 2/5
I, on the other hand, will probably not be coming back. I was really excited and surprised when I saw that one of their 7 signature subs was vegetarian (and absolutely loved the name lol). The sandwich itself is very bland, however. It's loaded up with roasted veggies and mozzarella, topped with lettuce and tomato tossed in a very light dressing. If I didn't know any better, I'd say the sandwich was healthy (gasp), and admittedly, not what I want in a sandwich. There was a lack of flavor and texture, and I got a quarter of the way through my sandwich before I got really bored with it, and I was just forcing myself to finish the entire half (and I couldn't). The sandwich wasn't inedible, it was just... boring and tasteless. "A" for effort, but load that shit up with some flavor.

Fries: 3/5
Potato salad: 4/5

Overall: 4/5
I know I was hating on the meat hater, but I do really think this place is good as long as you don't get it. Great service, reasonably priced for huge portions, and good food for meat eaters. As for vegetarians? Try somewhere else.

Ordered from the new fort apache location and OMG! It is amazing!! The meat stix are the bomb.. the grilled cheese is even better! The staff is so friendly and welcoming. I will definitely be back! I ordered 30.00 worth of food for myself!!! No regrets! See you guys soon!!
Courtesy stuffed with a cool and cl an atmosphere, wrapped in an original theme with a side of wit and a dash incredible food. Awesome spot for a delicious sub.

Ahh! I'm so happy that this place opened up near our house. My boyfriend and I ate at Magic Noodle the other day and noticed the spankin' new Sinful Subs in the same center and thought about trying it. Sure enough we tried it the next day. 

We ordered the knuckle sandwich and the skinny dip sandwich as these are the two favorites. The knuckle sandwich had a good amount of ham, salami, and pepperoni. The lettuce and tomatoes on top was so fresh. You get the warm sandwich with the cool topping, it's a great combination! Their skinny dip was definitely out of this world. It was really good! I devoured it all. It's hard to find a good French dip in Vegas but this one was delicious. It's comparable to the one at the Bar. 

I would recommend this place when you're craving sandwiches.

Would give this place 0 stars if I could. Says it's open but came here in December only to find it closed and sign saying open in January. Came came by today went to find it closed since February 7th this place sucks I drove all the way out from Boulder City twice and they should put on their website if they're not going to be open
